title: Colombo Municipal Council inaugural sitting on June 16
byline: The newly elected Colombo Municipal Council, following the conduct of the Local Government (LG) election on May 6, is scheduled to convene for its inaugural sitting on June 16, 2025.

title: English language should be a tool to broaden opportunities, not to widen social disparities – PM Harini
byline: Teaching English as a language should serve as a means to broaden opportunities, not as a tool to create social disparities, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (04), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Canada, US warn of air quality hazards as Canadian fire smoke reaches Europe
byline: Canada’s wildfires, which have already forced evacuations of more than 26,000 people, continued their stubborn spread on Tuesday (Jun 3), with heavy smoke choking millions of Canadians and Americans and reaching as far away as Europe.

title: Fire breaks out in a shop in Bokundara
byline: A fire has reportedly broken out in a shop located in Bokundara, Piliyandala.

title: Deputy PM of Australia concludes official visit to Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Defence of Australia Richard Marles has concluded his official visit to Sri Lanka and departed to India.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon appears before inquiry committee in Parliament
byline: Suspended Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has appeared before the three-member committee of inquiry, appointed to investigate and report on allegations of misconduct and serious abuse of office against him.

title: English should be a tool to broaden opportunities, not to widen social disparities – PM Harini
byline: Teaching English as a language should serve as a means to broaden opportunities, not as a tool to create social disparities, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: 20,000 people being evacuated after unexploded World War II bombs discovered in Cologne
byline: Around 20,000 people are being evacuated from their homes in the German city of Cologne as experts try to defuse three Second World War bombs.

title: Teen TikTok star shot dead in Pakistan after man broke into her home
byline: A 22-year-old man has been arrested in Pakistan and confessed to the murder of 17-year-old social media influencer Sana Yousaf, according to police.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been further remanded until Friday (June 6), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Indian pilot set for a historic space journey on Axiom-4
byline: The Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4), set to take off from Nasa’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida next week, will be piloted by an Indian as it soars towards the International Space Station.

title: SriLankan Airlines’ new Airbus A330-200 aircraft arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The newly acquired Airbus A330-200 aircraft by SriLankan Airlines entered Sri Lanka’s airspace a short while ago.

title: ASPI reaches new all-time high for second day
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has recorded significant gains once again today (04) to close at an all-time high for the second successive day.

title: 59-year-old dies after falling from building in Wellawatte
byline: A 59-year-old man has fallen to his death from a five-storey building on Ramakrishna Road in Wellawatte, according to the Wellawatte Police.

title: Colombo HC to hear ‘Sathosa’ case against Johnston Fernando in July
byline: The Colombo High Court today (04) ordered that a case filed against former Minister Johnston Fernando and two others be taken up on July 07 for further hearing of evidence.

title: Notable increase in number of people seeking assistance from President’s Fund: PMD
byline: The number of people seeking assistance from the President’s Fund has seen a notable increase, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: India’s active Covid-19 cases surge to 4,302, total deaths at 44
byline: India reported a rise of 276 active Covid cases on Wednesday, pushing the total number to 4,302, according to data released by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

title: Sri Lanka expresses deep concern regarding current humanitarian situation in Gaza
byline: The government of Sri Lanka has expressed deep concern regarding the current humanitarian situation in Gaza.

title: Supplementary Medical Professionals to launch strike tomorrow
byline: The Joint Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) has announced that it will commence a strike tomorrow (June 5), citing several unresolved demands, including issues related to the healthcare sector.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with petitions filed over issuance of liquor licenses in 2024
byline: The Supreme Court has granted leave to proceed with two petitions filed seeking a ruling that then-President Ranil Wickremesinghe, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance Minister, violated fundamental human rights by issuing liquor licenses in violation of the Excise Ordinance after the announcement of the Presidential Election in 2024.

title: Australia formally hands over Beechcraft King Air 350 aircraft to Sri Lanka Air Force
byline: Australia has formally handed over the Beechcraft King Air 350 aircraft to Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF).

title: South Korea’s new President Lee takes power after sweeping election win
byline: South Korea’s center-left Lee Jae-myung was declared president Wednesday after winning a snap election, taking the helm of a nation deeply divided after his predecessor’s disastrous attempt to declare martial law.

title: Beta makes first electric flight into New York City airport
byline: Beta Technologies’ Alia CX300 on Tuesday become the first all-electric aircraft to land at a New York City airport.

title: Pope Leo, in first month, makes a break in style from Francis
byline: In his first month, Pope Leo has taken a very different approach to his predecessor Francis.

title: North Face and Cartier customer data stolen in cyber attacks
byline: Fashion brand The North Face and luxury jeweller Cartier have become the latest retailers to report having customer data stolen in cyber attacks.

title: Sri Lanka received USD 650 million in FDI in first quarter: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka received USD 650 million in Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) during the first quarter of this year (2025), according to Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi.

title: 11 dead, 50 injured in stampede outside Bengaluru stadium amid RCB celebrations
byline: The frenzied celebration in Bengaluru over RCB winning the IPL after 18 long years took a tragic turn with at least 11 people feared dead in a stampede.

title: 1.8bn in S. Asia, including Sri Lankans, face extreme heat risks by 2030 – World Bank
byline: Nearly 1.8 billion people across South Asia – including Sri Lanka – will face extreme heat risks by 2030, but income constraints and market failures are leaving many to rely only on basic coping strategies, according to a new World Bank report.

title: No decision taken to discontinue Grade 5 Scholarship Exam - PM Harini
byline: No decision has been taken to do away with the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination for now, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: King of the Hill and Parks and Rec actor shot dead
byline: US actor Jonathan Joss has been shot dead in what his husband says was a homophobic hate crime, although police have said they have found no evidence of that.

title: Tense situation reported between navy and several fishermen in Trinco seas
byline: A heated situation has been reported between Sri Lanka Navy personnel and a group of fishermen in 11 vessels during a special operation conducted on June 3 (Tuesday) to apprehend those engaged in illegal poaching activities in seas off Kuchchaveli in Trincomalee.

title: Suspected gunman in ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder not identified by witnesses
byline: The suspected gunman in the shooting and killing of notorious drug trafficker and criminal gang leader Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, also known as ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ was produced before an identification parade held at the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (4).

title: Four students remanded over ragging incident at Kuliyapitiya Technical College
byline: Three male senior students and one female student, who were arrested in connection with the attempted suicide of a first-year student at the Kuliyapitiya Technical College, have been remanded until June 16.

title: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara appears before CID
byline: MP Dayasiri Jayasekara appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this afternoon (June 4) to record a statement.

title: Pressure mounts on Netanyahu as opposition moves to dissolve parliament
byline: A member of Israel’s right-wing coalition threatened to quit the cabinet on Wednesday and support an opposition motion to dissolve parliament tabled for next week, piling pressure on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: President instructs Treasury officials to implement structural reforms in key institutions based on core govt policy
byline: Achieving economic success alone is not sufficient for a nation’s development, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized today (04), highlighting that economic progress must be accompanied by social development and a transformation in political culture.

title: Fisheries Minister orders investigation into Kuchchaveli incident
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has been instructed to conduct a thorough investigation into the incident that occurred in the sea area off Kuchchaveli in Trincomalee, and to submit a detailed report as soon as possible, according to the Fisheries Ministry.
